comment: Professor Stewart was great! I took her for a 6 week online course and usually those courses are super fast paced and rigorous, but she made the course load super manageable! Graded by weekly discussion posts+peer responses, one film review of your choice, and a final paper. Super lenient grader and is pretty easy to reach via email. Take her class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Stewart is very kind and everything you need to know is in the syllabus. The class mostly consists of a discussion post and every other week and one student reply. There's two papers in the entire class, including a final paper instead of an exam. A lot of the stuff we have to read is really interesting and dives into unexpected topics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is amazing! Very simple, fun, and manageable! If you are looking for an easy class to take, this is it!

This class is 100% reading and writing. No tests, the entire course is made up of Discussion Posts and two papers. Each module is two weeks and covers two theorists that you will then have to write a DP about and respond to two others. I enjoy writing, so this did not bother me. Overall it was an easy class for me.
This professor is amazing. This class played a huge role in me landing a lucrative career as a a Starbucks barista.

Loved this class! The class itself is guided by the course book that had interesting readings. Weekly readings and discussion posts, easy if you follow the rubric! The final/midterm were both papers but were easy/interesting to do! I enjoyed her class and was helpful when I had questions! sweet professor definitely recommend her!

this class's content is very hard, it is super dense and theoretical. As long as you put effort into your work, you'll get an A. She also offers so much extra credit (5 points on each discussion for replying to one person, an extra discussion post for up to 55 points, and 50 points for doing the course evaluation).

The content of this class is very, very theoretical and dense. The books we read are written at a master's degree level. However, she will almost always give you a 100. Grades take a while to get back, but she is very nice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class was super laid back and interesting. I highly recommend taking her as a professor. There are weekly readings, discussion posts, and responses, but everything is straight forward. She makes it easy to understand and promotes a healthy environment to discuss with peers. There are two papers, but they are easy to complete

I learned a lot. Not much interaction with her but she seems very nice and easy grader. Graded by few assignments so it was an easy class load, just like 6 discussion boards, two papers, and extra credit. Just do good on the papers, submit all the assignments, and try to understand the concepts of the class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Stewart was well educated in her topic, the bookwork was never boring, and she gives out plenty of extra credit. I felt very respected in her class, and she is a wonderful teacher to learn from. I absolutely recommend taking one of her classes.

My final grade was well over 100. So many extra credit opportunities, an incredibly lenient grader (I got a 100 on everything) and such a kind professor. She also gave out several extensions. Amy is an insightful professor but also cares deeply about her students. Easily the best prof I've ever had. I never read or bought the textbook, fwiw.
